trans-unit.source: Provides the base class for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter"></xref> class.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The MultiPartWriter class and its inherited classes provide services and helper methods for adapters to perform rendering.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This is the base class for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class.
The base <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> object.
Adds a resource reference to the given URL, with the optional MIME type for the specified content.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The behavior of this method is reserved for future versions.
The URL to add the resource reference to.
Adds a resource reference to the given URL, with the optional MIME type for the specified content.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The behavior of this method is reserved for future versions.
The URL to add the resource reference to.
(Optional) The MIME type of the content.
This method begins a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page adapter must call this method before rendering the page, but after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter.BeginResponse%2A> method.
An exception is raised if the BeginFile method is called more than once.
The unique URL for the file.
The MIME type of the file.
The character set used for the file (usually, the same as <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse.Charset%2A?displayProperty=fullName>).
Begins a response.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The BeginResponse method must be called by the page only once, before calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter.BeginFile%2A> method, and before rendering the page.
Ends a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page adapter must call this method after rendering the page, but before calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter.EndResponse%2A> method.
Ends a response.
The page adapter must call this method after rendering a page, and after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter.EndFile%2A> method.
Generates a unique URL.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method creates a unique URL by generating a GUID, converting it to a string, and appending the file name extension contained in the `filetype` parameter.
Contains the file name extension for the new URL.
A unique URL based on a globally unique ID (GUID).
Gets a value indicating whether multipart writing is supported.
Default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if multipart writing is supported; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
